title: About the visuals of the Runes Reforged...

embed.description: This preseason, we're combining runes and masteries into a single, streamlined system that you can use to adapt and customize your playstyle in champ select. We're removing the level 30 cap, and the new cap is... infinity! We're also replacing the IP grind with a revamped rewards system that levels up with you.

body:
... I wanna say a thank you to the Riot artists.
The visual look stunning and you did an amazing job with it.

Many people gonna do some theory crafting about the new runes (which is gonna be fun), but I really love the looks of it.

I mean, just look at it.

replies.body:
I love how the design of the runes is influenced by common designs from factions in League of Legends.

Precision looks Demacian.
Domination looks Noxian.
Sorcery looks like the Shadow Isles.
Resolve looks Freljordian.
And Inspiration is Targonian.

I would just have wished that one of the runes has a Piltovian/Zaunite inspiration for it's design, but meh.
They probably didn't chose it since runes are magical and these places are more about technology....

I'd say sorcery is more likely world rune related,making it more of a factionless mastery.

In general all of these runes could represent world runes from different locations.

I think Sorcery is either void or Shadow Isles, but can't really tell.
But yes, they all probably represent world runes in different areas.

EDIT:
http://universe-meeps.leagueoflegends.com/v1/assets/images/factions/image-gallery/shadow-isles-crator.jpg
This is a picture from LoL universe of the Shadow Isles. This and the misty castle in the background of the rune convinced me that this rune represents the Shadow Isles.

The thing is that the shadow isles have a much more darker and ghastly atmosphere,so I kinda doubt that it is meant to be part of the shadow isles.

It is possible that it is from the shadow isles(maybe before the corruption?),but I doubt it.

I mean, Hextech is literally "Magic Technology"...

The only weird influence is precision being Demacian because they aren't exactly fond of magic.
It could also be Shurima judging from the gold color scheme and the fact that the flags around the rune have what looks like the Shurima emblem on it.

Right, could have looked cool if the rune would have been in some kind of gigantic device in a laboratory and there are some scientists investigating it.

But well, the design is there and they won't make big changes like that anymore. Just personal disappointment since Zaun and Piltover are my favourite regions.^^

I'm the only one think the Precision one gives more Shurima vibes?

Inspiration 100% Targion, since it has the basic principle of "Outwit mere mortals".
About Sorcery - I would go for the Blessed Isle as inspiration (aka pre-Shadow Isles).

The rest sound more or less fine to me.

I see more of:

- Precision is Demacia (very white and marble looking)
- Domination is Noxus (black and red with very dark rocks has always been Noxus)
- Sorcery is Freljord (very notherern area near HA although also has a very "Ryze" feel)
- Resolve is Targon (mountainous terrain and away from civilization)
- Inspiration is Ionia (reminds me a ton of Bard's trailer, which is in Ionia)

I think with the current information we have, some of these assumptions are way off.

Looking at LoL universe, Sorcery seems most likely like Shadow Isles.
http://universe-meeps.leagueoflegends.com/v1/assets/images/factions/image-gallery/shadow-isles-crator.jpg
This is a picture of a place in the shadow isles. Looks pretty similar, the whole atmosphere, the ground, the magic energy in the air. And you can see an old castle in the background. Even some mist. That's why I think Shadow Isles is most likely.

Resolve:
The mountainous terrain is actually a pretty fitting description for Freljord.
Another picture of LoL universe of this area.
http://universe-meeps.leagueoflegends.com/v1/assets/images/factions/image-gallery/freljord-rakelstake.jpg
Again, looks similar. Mountains, pine trees and no zivilisation. And the design of the rune itself says Freljordian more than Targonian.

Inspiration:
The runes in the middle of the gyroscope show stars, a common motive for targon.
It is on the top of a mountain, not at the down end of it like the Resolve tree. More fitting for Mount Targon, since the whole theme is "closer to the stars". And the circular motives of the gyroscope are common for Targonian designs as well.
